page.title: 01Kirkconnel House and area.
page.content: Kirkconnel estate is close to the village of New Abbey in Kircudbrightshire. The property is owned by Mr Maxwell Witham who is descended from the Maxwells of Caerlaverock Castle, Dumfriesshire. The house incorporates the tower dated from approximatley the 13th century, the white section is 17th. century with an additional structure of the Queen Anne period and the red brick part is the first of this style in mid 18th century Scotland. The estate covers 3000 acres with 500 woodland (both deciduous and pine trees) and 1000 used for agriculture. There are several farms. At the Northern end is Kirkconnel Flow Nature Reserve in care of the Nature Conservancy A spider and moss here are both rare. Visitng the reserve is by permit only. The river Nith
